snippet: A new study challenges Congressional assertions that grants by the National Endowment for the Arts support programming attended mostly by the rich.
abstract: National Center for Arts Research at Southern Methodist University study challenges Congressional assertions that grants by National Endowment for the Arts support programming attended mostly by wealthy; counters that federally supported arts programs attract people across income spectrum.
lead_paragraph: A new study challenges Congressional assertions that grants by the National Endowment for the Arts support programming attended mostly by the rich.

headline.main: N.E.A. Funds Benefit Both Rich and Poor, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: N.E.A. Funds Benefit Both Rich and Poor, Study Finds
